intro: Tarenna laurentii, commonly known as the African star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its pleasant fragrance and attractive appearance. Tarenna laurentii prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for shaded garden areas or indoor cultivation.
